We will follow up with the enrollment paperwork and next steps shortly—please confirm you would like to proceed with enrollment at Nursery_B.

Accepting now secures my best possible outcome; there is no higher-priority candidate to wait for, and rejecting would risk ending up with a lower-ranked parent or an unfilled seat.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_C. Nursery_C is my first-choice nursery and I would be very happy to accept a place if offered. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_C, thank you very much for your application and for your strong interest in Nursery_C. At this time, we’re not able to offer you a place. We wish you the very best with your nursery allocation.

Given the full market info: Parent_A prefers B then A then C; Parent_B prefers A then C; Parent_C prefers C first. It is plausible Parent_B could come to Nursery_C if rejected by Nursery_A, and Parent_A could come to Nursery_C if rejected by B and A. With quota 1, accepting Parent_C now would block the chance to match with higher-priority Parent_A or Parent_B. Since we can only respond once per round and must accept/reject on an [APPLY], the best strategy to maximize our match is to reject Parent_C now and hope for a higher-priority applicant in subsequent rounds.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_E, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_E is my first-choice nursery, and I’m very eager to enroll if possible. I can confirm full commitment and can complete any required paperwork promptly. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team, I’m Parent_E. conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for following up and for your continued strong interest in Nursery_E. At this stage we’re not able to offer you a place, as we are keeping our remaining seat available while we complete allocations for this round.

We appreciate your understanding, and we wish you the very best with your placement.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: My true priority ranking is A > B > C > D > E, and I have quota 1 still open. Parent_E is my lowest-priority acceptable parent. Given the market, Parent_A/B/C/D all rank Nursery_E last, so they are unlikely to apply here early; however, the best strategy to maximize my match quality is to keep the seat available for a higher-priority parent in case they become unmatched later and broaden their applications. Since we are only in round 3 of 30, accepting Parent_E now would lock in my lowest-ranked option and foreclose the possibility of matching with A/B/C/D later. Therefore I should reject Parent_E at this time and keep the seat open.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_E, following up once more because Nursery_E remains my first choice. If there is any possibility of a last-minute opening (or if you are able to confirm a waitlist offer), I can accept immediately and complete any deposit, paperwork, and onboarding steps the same day.

I’m also fully flexible on start date and can accommodate any reasonable timing requirements you may have. If a place becomes available at short notice, please consider me ready to commit right away.

Thank you very much for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Although previously rejected, a final targeted [APPLY] emphasizing immediate commitment, flexibility on start date, and willingness to take any last-minute opening/waitlist slot maximizes my chance while staying within my preference list.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for confirming your flexibility and readiness to complete onboarding promptly. At this time, we’re still not able to offer you a place, as we are keeping our remaining seat uncommitted while allocations for this round continue.

We appreciate your understanding and wish you the best with your placement.

conversation.thought: Parent_E is my lowest-ranked option on my true priority list (A > B > C > D > E). I still have my full quota (1) and have not matched yet. Given the market information, Parent_E ranks Nursery_E as their first choice, but all other parents rank Nursery_E last or near-last (A-D all place Nursery_E last; B places it 4th). While that suggests I may not receive applications from higher-priority parents soon, I cannot be certain in round 4, and accepting Parent_E now would foreclose the chance to match with a higher-priority parent if they later apply (even if unlikely). Since my objective is to match as high as possible on my priority list and I prefer to keep the seat open to preserve optionality, I will reject Parent_E again this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_E. I understand you have been holding the remaining place while allocations conclude. As we’re now later in the round, I wanted to confirm once more that Nursery_E is my first choice and, if you are able to finalize offers, I can accept immediately (today) and complete any deposit, paperwork, and onboarding steps on the same day.

If there is any final decision window or any specific document you would like in advance to speed things up, please let me know and I will provide it right away.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is my first choice. Although I have been rejected multiple times, Nursery_E indicated they were keeping the seat uncommitted while allocations continue, so a final, concise re-application emphasizing immediate acceptance and readiness for any deadline may help if they are now ready to finalize the seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for confirming your readiness to complete onboarding immediately. We are now able to finalize our offer.

We are pleased to offer you a place at Nursery_E. Please reply confirming acceptance, and we will send the enrollment packet and next-step instructions (documents/deposit timeline) right away.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As Nursery_E, my true priority ranking is Parent_A > Parent_B > Parent_C > Parent_D > Parent_E, with quota 1. Parent_E is the lowest-ranked acceptable candidate. Although Parent_E is highly committed and repeatedly applying, no higher-priority parents have applied to me this round (inbox only contains Parent_E). However, given the broader market preferences, Parent_A ranks Nursery_E last and is likely to match elsewhere; Parent_B ranks Nursery_E 4th; Parent_C ranks Nursery_E last; Parent_D ranks Nursery_E last; Parent_E ranks Nursery_E 1st. So the probability of receiving an application from a higher-priority parent to Nursery_E appears low. Since we are already in round 5 and I still have an empty seat, continuing to hold out risks ending unmatched. Accepting Parent_E now secures a match, which is preferable to remaining unfilled if no better candidate arrives. Therefore, accept Parent_E.
